abstract_policy.title: abstract_policy - policy.AbstractPolicy

assignment_order.description:
Assignment order decides the order in which the next identifier is allocated.  Options are:
  * default
  * sequential: (default)
assignment_order.title: assignment_order

name.description: Name of the profile instance or profile template.

serial_number.description: Serial Number of the Device.  You can assign unknown if you want to generate the Profile without assigning hardware.
serial_number.title: serial_number

adapter_configuration.description: An Adapter Configuration Policy configures the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel settings for the VIC adapter.
adapter_configuration.title: adapter_configuration - Adapter Configuration - Intersight Uri: adapter/ConfigPolicies

allOf.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'adapter.ConfigPolicy', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
allOf.title: adapter_configuration

add_vic_adapter_configuration.description:
List of 'adapter.ConfigPolicy' resources
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
add_vic_adapter_configuration.title: add_vic_adapter_configuration - Add Vic Adapter Configuration

enable_fip.description: Default is `true`.  Status of FIP protocol on the adapter interfaces.
enable_fip.title: enable_fip

enable_lldp.description: Default is `true`.  Status of LLDP protocol on the adapter interfaces.
enable_lldp.title: enable_lldp

enable_port_channel.description: Default is `true`.  When Port Channel is enabled, two vNICs and two vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card. When disabled, four vNICs and four vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card. Disabling port channel reboots the server. Port Channel is supported only for Cisco VIC 1455/1457 adapters.
enable_port_channel.title: enable_port_channel

pci_slot.description: PCIe slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
pci_slot.title: pci_slot

adapter_configuration.add_vic_adapter_co.description:
Settings applicable for the Data Center Ethernet (DCE) interfaces on the adapter card.
Required Attributes:
  * dce_interface_fec_modes
adapter_configuration.add_vic_adapter_co.title: dce_interface_settings

items.description:
Default is 'cl91'.  Forward Error Correction (FEC) mode setting for the DCE interfaces of the adapter. FEC mode setting is supported only for Cisco VIC 14xx adapters. FEC mode 'cl74' is unsupported for Cisco VIC 1495/1497. This setting will be ignored for unsupported adapters and for unavailable DCE interfaces.
  * `cl74` - Use cl74 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 74' aka FC-FEC ('FireCode' FEC) offers simple, low-latency protection against 1 burst/sparse bit error, but it is not good for random errors.
  * `cl91` - Use cl91 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 91' aka RS-FEC ('ReedSolomon' FEC) offers better error protection against bursty and random errors but adds latency.
  * `Off` - Disable FEC mode on the DCE Interface.
items.title: dce_interface_fec_mode

dce_interface_fec_modes.title: dce_interface_fec_modes - Dce Interface Fec Modes - object_type: adapter.DceInterfaceSettings

bios.description: Policy for setting BIOS tokens on the endpoint.
bios.title: bios - Bios - Intersight Uri: bios/Policies

allOf.description: Policy for setting BIOS tokens on the endpoint.
allOf.title: bios

bios_template.description:
Name of a BIOS Template to Configure.  Options are:
  * M5-amd-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with AMD Processor.
  * M5-intel-dss(-tpm) - Analytics Database Systems.
  * M5-intel-hpc(-tpm) - High-Performance Computing.
  * M5-intel-java(-tpm) - Java Application Servers.
  * M5-intel-oltp(-tpm) - Online Transaction Processing.
  * M5-intel-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with Intel Processor.
  * M6-amd-hpc(-tpm) - High-Performance Computing with AMD Processor.
  * M6-amd-vdi(-tpm) - Virtual Desktop Host with AMD Processor.
  * M6-amd-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with AMD Processor.
  * M6-intel-analytical-db(-tpm) - M6 Analytical Database Systems with Intel Processor.
  * M6-intel-azure(-tpm) - Azure HCI Host with Intel Processor.
  * M6-intel-data-analytics(-tpm) - M6 Data Analytics with Intel Processor.
  * M6-intel-hpc(-tpm) - High-Performance Computing with Intel Processor.
  * M6-intel-relational-db(-tpm) - M6 Relational Database Systems with Intel Processor.
  * M6-intel-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with Intel Processor.
  * M7-amd-hpc(-tpm) - High-Performance Computing with AMD Processor.
  * M7-amd-vdi(-tpm) - Virtual Desktop Host with AMD Processor.
  * M7-amd-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with AMD Processor.
  * M7-intel-analytical-db(-tpm) - M6 Analytical Database Systems with Intel Processor.
  * M7-intel-azure(-tpm) - Azure HCI Host with Intel Processor.
  * M7-intel-data-analytics(-tpm) - M6 Data Analytics with Intel Processor.
  * M7-intel-hpc(-tpm) - High-Performance Computing with Intel Processor.
  * M7-intel-relational-db(-tpm) - M6 Relational Database Systems with Intel Processor.
  * M7-intel-virtual(-tpm) - Virtual Host with Intel Processor.
 Add `-tpm` to enable TPM.  Without `-tpm`, TPM is disabled.
bios_template.title: bios_template

allOf.title: boot_order

boot_devices.description:
List of Boot Devices and their Attributes to Assign to the Boot Policy.
`boot.Iscsi` Required Attributes:
  * interface_name
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.Iscsi` Optional Attributes:

  * enabled
  * port
  * slot

`boot.LocalCdd` Required Attributes:

  * object_type

`boot.LocalCdd` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled

`boot.LocalDisk` Required Attributes:

  * object_type

`boot.LocalDisk` Optional Attributes:

`boot.Nvme` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.Nvme` Optional Attributes:

`boot.PchStorage` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.PchStorage` Optional Attributes:

  * lun

`boot.Pxe` Required Attributes:
  * interface_name
  * interface_source
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.Pxe` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled
  * ip_type
  * mac_ddress
  * port
  * slot

`boot.San` Required Attributes:
  * interface_name
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.San` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader

  * lun
  * slot

`boot.SdCard` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type
  * sub_type

`boot.SdCard` Optional Attributes:

  * lun

`boot.UefiShell` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type

`boot.UefiShell` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled

`boot.Usb` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type
  * sub_type

`boot.Usb` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled

`boot.VirtualMedia` Required Attributes:
  * name
  * object_type
  * sub_type

`boot.VirtualMedia` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled
boot_devices.title: boot_devices - Boot Devices - object_type: boot.DeviceBase

boot_mode.description:
Default is `Uefi`.  Sets the BIOS boot mode. UEFI uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) whereas Legacy mode uses the MBR partitioning scheme. To apply this setting, Please reboot the server.
  * `Uefi` - UEFI mode uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) to locate EFI Service Partitions to boot from.
  * `Legacy` - Legacy mode refers to the traditional process of booting from BIOS. Legacy mode uses the MBR to locate the bootloader.
boot_mode.title: boot_mode

enable_secure_boot.description: Default is `true`.  If UEFI secure boot is enabled, the boot mode is set to UEFI by default. Secure boot enforces that device boots using only software that is trusted by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).
enable_secure_boot.title: enable_secure_boot

boot_order.boot_devices.description: Lists properties that are common to all device types. It serves as base class for other device types.
boot_order.boot_devices.title: boot_device

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Specifies if the boot device is enabled or disabled.
enabled.title: enabled

interface_name.description: The name of the underlying virtual ethernet interface used by the PXE or SAN boot device.
interface_name.title: interface_name

interface_source.description:
Default when assigned is `name`.  Lists the supported Interface Source for PXE device. Supported values are "name" and "mac".
  * `name` - Use interface name to select virtual ethernet interface.
  * `mac` - Use MAC address to select virtual ethernet interface.
  * `port` - Use port to select virtual ethernet interface.
interface_source.title: interface_source

ip_type.description:
Default when assigned is `IPv4`.  The IP Address family type to use during the PXE Boot process.
  * `None` - Default value if IpType is not specified.
  * `IPv4` - The IPv4 address family type.
  * `IPv6` - The IPv6 address family type.
ip_type.title: ip_type

lun.description: Default is 1.  The Logical Unit Number (LUN) of the device. For SAN boot configuration to be deployed on a server with 1300 family of Cisco VIC adapters, the recommendation is for the boot LUN to be numbered as 0 to ensure that LUN is mounted as the first disk from which the server boots.
lun.title: lun

mac_address.description: The MAC Address of the underlying virtual ethernet interface used by the PXE boot device.
mac_address.title: mac_address

name.description: A name that helps identify a boot device. It can be any string that adheres to the following constraints. It should start and end with an alphanumeric character. It can have underscores and hyphens. It cannot be more than 30 characters.
name.title: name

object_type.description:
The Boot Order Type to Assign to the Boot Device.  Allowed Values are:
  * boot.Iscsi
  * boot.LocalCdd
  * boot.LocalDisk
  * boot.Nvme
  * boot.PchStorage
  * boot.Pxe
  * boot.San
  * boot.SdCard
  * boot.UefiShell
  * boot.Usb
  * boot.VirtualMedia
object_type.title: object_type

port.description: boot.Iscsi can be 0-255.  boot.Pxe is the Port ID of the adapter and values can be between -1 (not defined) and 255.
port.title: port

slot.description: Options for boot.Iscsi, boot.Pxe and boot.San are 1-255, MLOM, L1, L2.  boot.Iscsi and boot.Pxe also support L and OCP.  For boot.LocalDisk values can be 1-205, FMEZZ1-SAS, HBA, M, MRAID, MRAID1, MRAID2, MSTOR-RAID, SAS, RAID.
slot.title: slot

sub_type.description:
The subtype for the selected device type.
The Following Boot Order Types utilize the Subtype Attribute:
boot.SdCard - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-util - Use of FlexUtil (microSD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-flash - Use of FlexFlash (SD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * SDCARD - Use of SD card as sub type for the SD Card boot device.
boot.Usb - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for USB boot device.
  * usb-cd - Use of Compact Disk (CD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-fdd - Use of Floppy Disk Drive (FDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-hdd - Use of Hard Disk Drive (HDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
boot.VirtualMedia - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for virtual media.
  * cimc-mapped-dvd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual DVD device.
  * cimc-mapped-hdd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual HDD device.
  * kvm-mapped-dvd - A KVM mapped DVD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-hdd - A KVM mapped HDD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-fdd - A KVM mapped FDD virtual media device.
sub_type.title: sub_type

wwpn.description: The WWPN Address of the underlying fibre channel interface used by the SAN boot device. Value must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
wwpn.title: wwpn

boot_order.boot_devices.boot_loader.description: Details of the bootloader to be used.
boot_order.boot_devices.boot_loader.title: bootloader - Boot Loader Parameters

ethernet_adapter.title: ethernet_adapter - Ethernet Adapter - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthAdapterPolicies

enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering.description: Default is `false`.  Status of Accelerated Receive Flow Steering on the virtual ethernet interface.
enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering.title: enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering

enable_advanced_filter.description: Default is `false`.  Enables advanced filtering on the interface.
enable_advanced_filter.title: enable_advanced_filter

enable_geneve_offload.description: Default is `false`.  GENEVE offload protocol allows you to create logical networks that span physical network boundaries by allowing any information to be encoded in a packet and passed between tunnel endpoints.
enable_geneve_offload.title: enable_geneve_offload

enable_interrupt_scaling.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Interrupt Scaling on the interface.
enable_interrupt_scaling.title: enable_interrupt_scaling

enable_nvgre_offload.description: Default is `false`.  Network Virtualization using Generic Routing Encapsulation Settings.
enable_nvgre_offload.title: enable_nvgre_offload

enable_vxlan_offload.description: Default is `false`.  Status of the Virtual Extensible LAN Protocol on the virtual ethernet interface.
enable_vxlan_offload.title: enable_vxlan_offload

receive_side_scaling_enable.description: Default is `true`.  Receive Side Scaling allows the incoming traffic to be spread across multiple CPU cores.
receive_side_scaling_enable.title: receive_side_scaling_enable

uplink_failback_timeout.description: Default is 5.  Uplink Failback Timeout in seconds when uplink failover is enabled for a vNIC. After a vNIC has started using its secondary interface, this setting controls how long the primary interface must be available before the system resumes using the primary interface for the vNIC.
uplink_failback_timeout.title: uplink_failback_timeout

ethernet_adapter.completion.title: completion - Completion Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.CompletionQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is 5.  The number of completion queue resources to allocate. In general, the number of completion queue resources to allocate is equal to the number of transmit queue resources plus the number of receive queue resources.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is 1.  The number of descriptors in each completion queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_adapter.interrupt_settings.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.interrupt_settings.title: interrupt_settings - Interrupt Settings - object_type: vnic.EthInterruptSettings

coalescing_type.description:
Default is `MIN`.  Interrupt Coalescing Type. This can be one of the following:- MIN  - The system waits for the time specified in the Coalescing Time field before sending another interrupt event IDLE - The system does not send an interrupt until there is a period of no activity lasting as least as long as the time specified in the Coalescing Time field.
  * `MIN` - The system waits for the time specified in the Coalescing Time field before sending another interrupt event.
  * `IDLE` - The system does not send an interrupt until there is a period of no activity lasting as least as long as the time specified in the Coalescing Time field.
coalescing_type.title: coalescing_type

mode.description:
Default is `MSIx`.  Preferred driver interrupt mode. This can be one of the following:- MSIx - Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI) with the optional extension. MSI  - MSI only. INTx - PCI INTx interrupts. MSIx is the recommended option.
  * `MSIx` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism with the optional extension (MSIx). MSIx is the recommended and default option.
  * `MSI` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism that treats messages as interrupts.
  * `INTx` - Line-based interrupt (INTx) mechanism similar to the one used in Legacy systems.
mode.title: mode

timer.description: Default is 125.  The time to wait between interrupts or the idle period that must be encountered before an interrupt is sent. To turn off interrupt coalescing, enter 0 (zero) in this field.
timer.title: timer

interrupts.description: Default is 8.  The number of interrupt resources to allocate. Typical value is be equal to the number of completion queue resources.
interrupts.title: interrupts

ethernet_adapter.receive.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.receive.title: receive - Receive Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.EthRxQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is 4.  The number of queue resources to allocate.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is 512.  The number of descriptors in each queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_adapter.receive_side_scaling.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.receive_side_scaling.title: receive_side_scaling - Recieve Side Scaling Hash Settings - object_type: vnic.RssHashSettings

enable_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the IPv4 address is used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv4_hash.title: enable_ipv4_hash

enable_ipv6_extensions_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, the IPv6 extensions are used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv6_extensions_hash.title: enable_ipv6_extensions_hash

enable_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the IPv6 address is used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv6_hash.title: enable_ipv6_hash

enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, both the IPv4 address and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash

enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 extensions and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash

enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 address and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash

enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv4 address and UDP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash.title: enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash

enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 address and UDP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash.title: enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash

ethernet_adapter.roce_settings.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.roce_settings.title: roce_settings - ROCE Settings - object_type: vnic.RoceSettings

cos.description:
Default is 5.  The Class of Service for RoCE on this virtual interface.
  * `5` - RDMA CoS Service Level 5.
  * `1` - RDMA CoS Service Level 1.
  * `2` - RDMA CoS Service Level 2.
  * `4` - RDMA CoS Service Level 4.
  * `6` - RDMA CoS Service Level 6.
cos.title: cos

enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled sets RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) on this virtual interface.
enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet.title: enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet

memory_regions.description: Default is 131072.  The number of memory regions per adapter. Recommended value = integer power of 2.
memory_regions.title: memory_regions

queue_pairs.description: Default is 256.  The number of queue pairs per adapter. Recommended value = integer power of 2.
queue_pairs.title: queue_pairs

resource_groups.description: Default is 2.  The number of resource groups per adapter. Recommended value = be an integer power of 2 greater than or equal to the number of CPU cores on the system for optimum performance.
resource_groups.title: resource_groups

version.description:
Default is 1.  Configure RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) version on the virtual interface. Only RoCEv1 is supported on Cisco VIC 13xx series adapters and only RoCEv2 is supported on Cisco VIC 14xx series adapters.
  * `1` - RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol Version 1.
  * `2` - RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol Version 2.
version.title: version

16RxQs-4G.Description: Recommended adapter settings for 16RxQs 4th Gen VIC.

16RxQs-5G.Description: Recommended adapter settings for 16RxQs 5th Gen VIC.

VMware-High-Trf.Description: Recommended adapter settings for VMware High Traffic.

ethernet_adapter.tcp_offload.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.tcp_offload.title: tcp_offload - TCP Offload Settings - object_type: vnic.TcpOffloadSettings

enable_large_recieve_offload.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the reassembly of segmented packets in hardware before sending them to the CPU.
enable_large_recieve_offload.title: enable_large_recieve_offload

enable_large_send_offload.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the CPU to send large packets to the hardware for segmentation.
enable_large_send_offload.title: enable_large_send_offload

enable_rx_checksum_offload.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the CPU sends all packet checksums to the hardware for validation.
enable_rx_checksum_offload.title: enable_rx_checksum_offload

enable_tx_checksum_offload.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the CPU sends all packets to the hardware so that the checksum can be calculated.
enable_tx_checksum_offload.title: enable_tx_checksum_offload

ethernet_adapter.transmit.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
ethernet_adapter.transmit.title: transmit - Transmit Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.EthTxQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is 1.  The number of queue resources to allocate.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is 256.  The number of descriptors in each queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_network.description: An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.
ethernet_network.title: ethernet_network - Ethernet Network - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthNetworkPolicies

allOf.description: An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.
allOf.title: ethernet_network

default_vlan.description: Default is 1.  Native VLAN ID of the virtual interface or the corresponding vethernet on the peer Fabric Interconnect to which the virtual interface is connected. Setting the ID to 0 will not associate any native VLAN to the traffic on the virtual interface.
default_vlan.title: default_vlan

vlan_mode.description:
Default is `ACCESS`.  Option to determine if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic.
  * `ACCESS` - An access port carries traffic only for a single VLAN on the interface.
  * `TRUNK` - A trunk port can have two or more VLANs configured on the interface. It can carry traffic for several VLANs simultaneously.
vlan_mode.title: vlan_mode

ethernet_network_control.description: The features that are applied on a vethernet that is connected to the vNIC.
ethernet_network_control.title: ethernet_network_control - Ethernet Network Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkControlPolicies

action_on_uplink_fail.description:
Default is `linkDown`.  Determines the state of the virtual interface (vethernet / vfc) on the switch when a suitable uplink is not pinned.
  * `linkDown` - The vethernet will go down in case a suitable uplink is not pinned.
  * `warning` - The vethernet will remain up even if a suitable uplink is not pinned.
action_on_uplink_fail.title: action_on_uplink_fail

cdp_enable.description: Default is `false`.  Enables the CDP on an interface.
cdp_enable.title: cdp_enable

lldp_enable_receive.description: Default is `false`.  Determines if the LLDP frames can be received by an interface on the switch.
lldp_enable_receive.title: lldp_enable_receive

lldp_enable_transmit.description: Default is `false`.  Determines if the LLDP frames can be transmitted by an interface on the switch.
lldp_enable_transmit.title: lldp_enable_transmit

mac_register_mode.description:
Default is `nativeVlanOnly`.  Determines the MAC addresses that have to be registered with the switch.
  * `nativeVlanOnly` - Register only the MAC addresses learnt on the native VLAN.
  * `allVlans` - Register all the MAC addresses learnt on all the allowed VLANs.
mac_register_mode.title: mac_register_mode

mac_security_forge.description:
Default is `allow`.  Determines if the MAC forging is allowed or denied on an interface.
  * `allow` - Allows mac forging on an interface.
  * `deny` - Denies mac forging on an interface.
mac_security_forge.title: mac_security_forge

ethernet_network_group.description: The allowed VLAN/s on an interface.
ethernet_network_group.title: ethernet_network_group - Ethernet Network Group - Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkGroupPolicies

allowed_vlans.description: Allowed VLAN IDs of the virtual interface. A list of comma seperated VLAN ids and/or VLAN id ranges.
allowed_vlans.title: action_on_uplink_fail

native_vlan.description: Default is 1.  Native VLAN ID of the virtual interface or the corresponding vethernet on the peer Fabric Interconnect to which the virtual interface is connected. If the native VLAN is not a part of the allowed VLANs, it will automatically be added to the list of allowed VLANs.
native_vlan.title: native_vlan

ethernet_qos.description: An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters additional controls can be specified like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
ethernet_qos.title: ethernet_qos - Ethernet QoS - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthQosPolicies

allOf.description: An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters additional controls can be specified like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
allOf.title: ethernet_qos

burst.description: Default is 10240.  The burst traffic, in bytes, allowed on the vNIC.
burst.title: burst

cos.description: Default is 1.  Class of Service to be associated to the traffic on the virtual interface.
cos.title: cos

enable_trust_host_cos.description: Default is `false`.  Enables usage of the Class of Service provided by the operating system.
enable_trust_host_cos.title: enable_trust_host_cos

mtu.description: Default is 1500.  The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) or packet size that the virtual interface accepts.
mtu.title: mtu

priority.description:
Default is `Best Effort`.  The priority matching the System QoS specified in the fabric profile.
  * `Best Effort` - QoS Priority for Best-effort traffic.
  * `FC` - QoS Priority for FC traffic.
  * `Platinum` - QoS Priority for Platinum traffic.
  * `Gold` - QoS Priority for Gold traffic.
  * `Silver` - QoS Priority for Silver traffic.
  * `Bronze` - QoS Priority for Bronze traffic.
priority.title: priority

rate_limit.description: Default is 0.  The value in Mbps (0-10G/40G/100G depending on Adapter Model) to use for limiting the data rate on the virtual interface.
rate_limit.title: rate_limit

fc_zone.title: fc_zone - FC Zone - Intersight Uri: fabric/FcZonePolicies

fc_target_zoning_type.description:
Default is `SIMT`.  Type of FC zoning. Allowed values are SIST, SIMT and None.
  * `SIST` - The system automatically creates one zone for each vHBA and storage port pair. Each zone has two members.
  * `SIMT` - The system automatically creates one zone for each vHBA. Configure this type of zoning if the number of zones created is likely to exceed the maximum supported number of zones.
  * `None` - FC zoning is not configured.

fibre_channel_adapter.description: A Fibre Channel Adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
fibre_channel_adapter.title: fibre_channel_adapter - Fibre Channel Adapter - Intersight Uri: vnic/FcAdapterPolicies

allOf.description: A Fibre Channel Adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
allOf.title: fibre_channel_adapter

adapter_template.description:
Name of a Pre-Configured Adapter Policy.  Options are:
  * FCNVMeInitiator
  * FCNVMeTarget
  * Initiator
  * Linux
  * Solaris
  * Target
  * VMware
  * WindowsBoot
  * Windows
adapter_template.title: adapter_template

error_detection_timeout.description: Default is 2000.  Error Detection Timeout, also referred to as EDTOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that an error has occurred.
error_detection_timeout.title: error_detection_timeout

io_throttle_count.description: Default is 512.  The maximum number of data or control I/O operations that can be pending for the virtual interface at one time. If this value is exceeded, the additional I/O operations wait in the queue until the number of pending I/O operations decreases and the additional operations can be processed.
io_throttle_count.title: io_throttle_count

lun_queue_depth.description: Default is 20.  The number of commands that the HBA can send and receive in a single transmission per LUN.
lun_queue_depth.title: lun_queue_depth

maximum_luns_per_target.description: Default is 1024.  The maximum number of LUNs that the Fibre Channel driver will export or show. The maximum number of LUNs is usually controlled by the operating system running on the server. Lun Count value can exceed 1024 only for vHBA of type 'FC Initiator' and on servers having supported firmware version.
maximum_luns_per_target.title: maximum_luns_per_target

resource_allocation_timeout.description: Default is 10000.  Resource Allocation Timeout, also referred to as RATOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that a resource cannot be properly allocated.
resource_allocation_timeout.title: resource_allocation_timeout

fibre_channel_adapter.error_recovery.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
fibre_channel_adapter.error_recovery.title: error_recovery - Error Recovery Settings - object_type: vnic.FcErrorRecoverySettings

fcp_error_recovery.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Fibre Channel Error recovery.
fcp_error_recovery.title: fcp_error_recovery

io_retry_timeout.description: Default is 5.  The number of seconds the adapter waits before aborting the pending command and resending the same IO request.
io_retry_timeout.title: io_retry_timeout

link_down_timeout.description: Default is 30000.  The number of milliseconds the port should actually be down before it is marked down and fabric connectivity is lost.
link_down_timeout.title: link_down_timeout

port_down_io_retry.description: Default is 8.  The number of times an I/O request to a port is retried because the port is busy before the system decides the port is unavailable.
port_down_io_retry.title: port_down_io_retry

port_down_timeout.description: Default is 10000.  The number of milliseconds a remote Fibre Channel port should be offline before informing the SCSI upper layer that the port is unavailable. For a server with a VIC adapter running ESXi, the recommended value is 10000. For a server with a port used to boot a Windows OS from the SAN, the recommended value is 5000 milliseconds.
port_down_timeout.title: port_down_timeout

fibre_channel_adapter.flogi.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
fibre_channel_adapter.flogi.title: flogi - Fabric Login Settings - object_type: vnic.FlogiSettings

retries.description: Default is 8.  The number of times that the system tries to log in to the fabric after the first failure. Allowed range is 0-4294967295.

timeout.description: Default is 4000.  The number of milliseconds that the system waits before it tries to log in again.

fibre_channel_adapter.interrupt_settings.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
fibre_channel_adapter.interrupt_settings.title: interrupt_settings - Interrupt Settings - object_type: vnic.FcInterruptSettings

mode.description:
Default is `MSIx`.  The preferred driver interrupt mode. This can be one of the following:- MSIx - Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI) with the optional extension. MSI  - MSI only. INTx - PCI INTx interrupts. MSIx is the recommended option.
  * `MSIx` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism with the optional extension (MSIx). MSIx is the recommended and default option.
  * `MSI` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism that treats messages as interrupts.
  * `INTx` - Line-based interrupt (INTx) mechanism similar to the one used in Legacy systems.
mode.title: mode

timeout.description: Default is 20000.  The number of milliseconds that the system waits before it tries to log in again.
timeout.title: timeout

The Credentials to use to Authenticate to Download Firmware for the Environemnt.

  * cco_user
firmware_authenticate.title: firmware_authenticate

cco_password.description: Default is `1`.  The Cisco Software Download User Password.  i.e. `var.cco_password`.
cco_password.title: cco_password

cco_user.description: Default is `1`.  The Cisco Software Download User.  i.e. `var.cco_user`.
cco_user.title: cco_user

flow_control.description: Priority Flow Control setting for each port.
flow_control.title: flow_control - Flow Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/FlowControlPolicies

priority.description:
Default is `auto`.  Configure the Priority Flow Control (PFC) for each port to enable the no-drop behavior for the CoS defined by the System QoS Policy and an Ethernet QoS policy. If Auto and On is selected for PFC, the Receive and Send link level flow control will be Off.
  * `auto` - Enables the no-drop CoS values to be advertised by the DCBXP and negotiated with the peer.A successful negotiation enables PFC on the no-drop CoS.Any failures because of a mismatch in the capability of peers causes the PFC not to be enabled.
  * `on` - Enables PFC on the local port regardless of the capability of the peers.
  * `off` - Disable PFC on the local port regardless of the capability of the peers.
priority.title: priority

receive.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Link-level Flow Control configured in the receive direction.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
receive.title: receive

send.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Link-level Flow Control configured in the send direction.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
send.title: send

Type of the allocation for the identity in the reservation either static or dynamic (i.e. via pool).
  * dynamic - Identifiers to be allocated by system.
  * static - Identifiers are assigned by the user.  (default)
allocation_type.title: allocation_type

ip_type.description:
Type of the IP address that needs to be reserved.
  * IPv4 - IP V4 address type requested. (default)
  * IPv6 - IP V6 address type requested.
ip_type.title: ip_type

ipmi_over_lan.title: ipmi_over_lan - IPMI Over LAN - Intersight Uri: ipmioverlan/Policies

allOf.description: Intelligent Platform Management Interface Over LAN Policy.
allOf.title: ipmi_over_lan

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  State of the IPMI Over LAN service on the endpoint.
enabled.title: enabled

encryption_key.description: Default is `1`.  The Encryption Key Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.ipmi_key`.
encryption_key.title: encryption_key

privilege.description:
Default is `read-only`.  The highest privilege level that can be assigned to an IPMI session on a server. This configuration is supported by all standalone rack servers. FI-attached rack servers with firmware at minimum of 4.2.3a support this configuration. FI-attached blade servers do not support privilege level. Privilege level will be ignored for unsupported servers.
  * `admin` - Privilege to perform all actions available through IPMI.
  * `user` - Privilege to perform some functions through IPMI but restriction on performing administrative tasks.
  * `read-only` - Privilege to view information throught IPMI but restriction on making any changes.
privilege.title: privilege

iscsi_adapter.description: Set of iSCSI properties that govern the host-side behavior of the adapter.

dhcp_timeout.description: Default is 1.  The number of seconds to wait before the initiator assumes that the DHCP server is unavailable.
dhcp_timeout.title: dhcp_timeout

lun_busy_retry_count.description: Default is 1.  The number of times to retry the connection in case of a failure during iSCSI LUN discovery.
lun_busy_retry_count.title: lun_busy_retry_count

tcp_connection_timeout.description: Default is 1.  The number of seconds to wait until Cisco UCS assumes that the initial login has failed and the iSCSI adapter is unavailable.
tcp_connection_timeout.title: tcp_connection_timeout

iscsi_boot.description: Configuration parameters to enable a server to boot its operating system from an iSCSI target machine located remotely over a network.
iscsi_boot.title: iscsi_boot - iSCSI Boot - Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiBootPolicies

allOf.description: Configuration parameters to enable a server to boot its operating system from an iSCSI target machine located remotely over a network.
allOf.title: iscsi_boot

authentication.description:
Default is `none`.  When using Authentication which type of authentication should be used.
  Options are:
  * chap
  * mutual_chap
authentication.title: authentication

dhcp_vendor_id_iqn.description: Auto target interface that is represented via the Initiator name or the DHCP vendor ID. The vendor ID can be up to 32 alphanumeric characters.
dhcp_vendor_id_iqn.title: dhcp_vendor_id_iqn

initiator_ip_pool.description: The Name of the iSCSI IP Pool.
initiator_ip_pool.title: initiator_ip_pool

initiator_ip_source.description:
Default is `DHCP`.  Default is Source Type of Initiator IP Address - Auto/Static/Pool.
  * `DHCP` - The IP address is assigned using DHCP, if available.
  * `Static` - Static IPv4 address is assigned to the iSCSI boot interface based on the information entered in this area.
  * `Pool` - An IPv4 address is assigned to the iSCSI boot interface from the management IP address pool.
initiator_ip_source.title: initiator_ip_source

iscsi_adapter_policy.description: The Name of the iSCSI Adapter Policy to Assign to the iSCSI Boot Policy.
iscsi_adapter_policy.title: iscsi_adapter_policy

password.description: Default is `1`.  The iSCSI Remote Target Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.iscsi_boot_password`.
password.title: password

primary_target_policy.description: The Name of the iSCSI Static Target Policy to Assign to the iSCSI Boot Policy.
primary_target_policy.title: primary_target_policy

secondary_target_policy.description: The Name of the iSCSI Static Target Policy to Assign to the iSCSI Boot Policy.
secondary_target_policy.title: secondary_target_policy

target_source_type.description:
Default is `Auto`.  Source Type of Targets - Auto/Static.
  * `Static` - Type indicates that static target interface is assigned to iSCSI boot.
  * `Auto` - Type indicates that the system selects the target interface automatically during iSCSI boot.
target_source_type.title: target_source_type

username.description: User Id of Initiator/Target Interface. Enter between 1 and 128 characters, spaces, or special characters.
username.title: username

lun_id.title: lun_id

port.description: Default is 3260.  The port associated with the iSCSI target.

lan_connectivity.description: A LAN Connectivity Policy determines the network resources and the connections between the server and the LAN on the network. This policy uses Consistent Device Naming to configure the vNIC. You can configure a usNIC or VMQ connection for the vNIC to improve network performance.
lan_connectivity.title: lan_connectivity - LAN Connectivity - Intersight Uri: vnic/LanConnectivityPolicies

allOf.description: A LAN Connectivity Policy determines the network resources and the connections between the server and the LAN on the network. This policy uses Consistent Device Naming to configure the vNIC. You can configure a usNIC or VMQ connection for the vNIC to improve network performance.
allOf.title: lan_connectivity - LAN Connectivity - Intersight Uri: vnic/LanConnectivityPolicies

enable_azure_stack_host_qos.description: Default is `false`.  Enabling AzureStack-Host QoS on an adapter allows the user to carve out traffic classes for RDMA traffic which ensures that a desired portion of the bandwidth is allocated to it.
enable_azure_stack_host_qos.title: enable_azure_stack_host_qos

iqn_allocation_type.description:
Default is `None`.  Allocation Type of iSCSI Qualified Name - Static/Pool/None.
  * `None` - Type indicates that there is no IQN associated to an interface.
  * `Static` - Type represents that static IQN is associated to an interface.
  * `Pool` - Type indicates that IQN value is sourced from an associated pool.
iqn_allocation_type.title: iqn_allocation_type

iqn_pool.description: Default is IQN Pool to Assign to the Policy.
iqn_pool.title: iqn_pool

iqn_static_identifier.description: User provided static iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN) for use as initiator identifiers by iSCSI vNICs in a Fabric Interconnect domain.
iqn_static_identifier.title: iqn_static_identifier

target_platform.description:
Default is `FIAttached`.  The platform for which the server profile is applicable. It can either be a server that is operating in standalone mode or which is attached to a Fabric Interconnect managed by Intersight.
  * `Standalone` - Servers which are operating in standalone mode i.e. not connected to a Fabric Interconnected.
  * `FIAttached` - Servers which are connected to a Fabric Interconnect that is managed by Intersight.
target_platform.title: target_platform

vnic_placement_mode.description:
Default is `custom`.  The mode used for placement of vNICs on network adapters. It can either be Auto or Custom.
  * `custom` - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is manually chosen by the user.
  * `auto` - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is automatically determined by the system.
vnic_placement_mode.title: vnic_placement_mode

vnics.description:
List of VNICs to add to the LAN Connectivity Policy.
Required Attributes:
  * names
  * placement

Required for FIAttached:

  * enable_failover
  * ethernet_adapter_policy
  * ethernet_network_control_policy
  * ethernet_network_group_policies

Required for Standalone:

allOf.title: vnics

cdn_source.description:
Default is `vnic`.  Source of the CDN. It can either be user specified or be the same as the vNIC name.
  * `vnic` - Source of the CDN is the same as the vNIC name.
  * `user` - Source of the CDN is specified by the user.
cdn_source.title: cdn_source

enable_failover.description: Default is `false`.  Enabling failover ensures that traffic from the vNIC automatically fails over to the secondary Fabric Interconnect, in case the specified Fabric Interconnect path goes down. Failover applies only to Cisco VICs that are connected to a Fabric Interconnect cluster.
enable_failover.title: enable_failover

ethernet_adapter_policy.title: ethernet_adapter_policy

ethernet_network_group_policies.title: ethernet_network_group_policies - Ethernet Network Group Policies

ethernet_network_policy.title: ethernet_network_policy

ethernet_qos_policy.description: The Name of the Ethernet QoS Policy to Assign to the vNIC.
ethernet_qos_policy.title: ethernet_qos_policy

items.title: iscsi_boot_policy

iscsi_boot_policies.title: iscsi_boot_policies - Iscsi Boot Policies - Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiBootPolicies

mac_address_allocation_type.description:
Default is `POOL`.  Type of allocation selected to assign a MAC address for the vnic.
  * `POOL` - The user selects a pool from which the mac/wwn address will be leased for the Virtual Interface.
  * `STATIC` - The user assigns a static mac/wwn address for the Virtual Interface.
mac_address_allocation_type.title: mac_address_allocation_type

mac_address_pools.description: A List of MAC Pools to Assign to each of the vNIC(s).

items.description: Name of the MAC Pool.
items.title: mac_pool

mac_address_pools.title: mac_address_pools - Mac Address Pools - Intersight Uri: macpool/Pools

mac_addresses_static.description:
A List of Static MAC Addresses to Assign to the vNIC's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

items.description:
The MAC address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
To ensure uniqueness of MACs in the LAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the
following MAC prefix 00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.
items.title: mac_address

mac_addresses_static.title: mac_addresses_static - Mac Addresses Static

lan_connectivity.vnics.placement.description:
Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
Required Attributes:
  * pci_order

Optional Attributes:
  * pci_links
  * slot_ids
  * switch_ids
  * uplink_ports
lan_connectivity.vnics.placement.title: placement - Placement Settings - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_links.description: Default is 0.  The PCI Link used as transport for the virtual interface. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1385 which has two.

items.description: Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is 0-3
items.title: pci_link

pci_links.title: pci_links - Pci Link - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_order.description: The order in which the virtual interface is brought up. The order assigned to an interface should be unique for all the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel interfaces on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. The order should start from zero with no overlaps. The maximum value of PCI order is limited by the number of virtual interfaces (Ethernet and Fibre-Channel) on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1340, VIC 1380 and VIC 1385 which have two.

items.description: PCI Order Assigned to the Interface. The order should start from zero with no overlaps, including LAN and SAN Policies.
items.title: pci_order

pci_order.title: pci_order - Pci Order

slot_ids.description: List of PCIe Slots where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.

items.description: PCIe Slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
items.title: slot_id

slot_ids.title: slot_ids - Slot Ids - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

switch_ids.description:
A List of the fabric port(s) to which the vNICs will be associated.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is not set to either A or B for the standalone case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects. The value 'None' should be used.
  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.

items.description:
The fabric port to which the vNICs will be associated.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is not set to either A or B for the standalone case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects. The value 'None' should be used.
  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.
items.title: switch_id

switch_ids.title: switch_ids - Switch Ids - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

uplink_ports.description: Default is 0.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  This attribute is for Standalone Servers Only.

items.description: Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is 0-3
items.title: pci_link

uplink_ports.title: uplink_ports - Uplink Port - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

lan_connectivity.vnics.usnic_settings.description:
User Space NIC Settings that enable low-latency and higher throughput by bypassing the kernel layer when sending/receiving packets.
Optional Attributes:
  * class_of_service
  * number_of_usnics
  * usnic_adapter_policy
lan_connectivity.vnics.usnic_settings.title: usnic_settings - User Space NIC Settings - object_type: vnic.UsnicSettings

class_of_service.description: Default is 5.  Class of Service to be used for traffic on the usNIC.
class_of_service.title: class_of_service

number_of_usnics.description: Default is 1.  Number of usNIC interfaces to be created. Valid values are 1 to 255 when the usNIC is enabled. When the usNIC is disabled, the default value is 0.
number_of_usnics.title: number_of_usnics

usnic_adapter_policy.description: Ethernet Adapter policy to be associated with the User Space vNICs. The Transmit Queue and Receive Queue resource value of VMMQ adapter policy should be greater than or equal to the configured number of sub vNICs.
usnic_adapter_policy.title: usnic_adapter_policy

lan_connectivity.vnics.vmq_settings.description:
Virtual Machine Queue Settings for the virtual interface that allow efficient transfer of network traffic to the guest OS.
Optional Attributes:
  * enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue
  * enabled
  * number_of_interrupts
  * number_of_sub_vnics
  * number_of_virtual_machine_queues
  * vmmq_adapter_policy
lan_connectivity.vnics.vmq_settings.title: vmq_settings - Virtual Machine Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.VmqSettings

enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Virtual Machine Multi-Queue feature on the virtual interface. VMMQ allows configuration of multiple I/O queues for a single VM and thus distributes traffic across multiple CPU cores in a VM.
enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue.title: enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue

enabled.description: Default is `false`.  Enables VMQ feature on the virtual interface.
enabled.title: enabled

number_of_interrupts.description: Default is 16.  The number of interrupt resources to be allocated. Recommended value is the number of CPU threads or logical processors available in the server.
number_of_interrupts.title: number_of_interrupts

number_of_sub_vnics.description: Default is 64.  The number of sub vNICs to be created.
number_of_sub_vnics.title: number_of_sub_vnics

number_of_virtual_machine_queues.description: Default is 4.  The number of hardware Virtual Machine Queues to be allocated. The number of VMQs per adapter must be one more than the maximum number of VM NICs.
number_of_virtual_machine_queues.title: number_of_virtual_machine_queues

vmmq_adapter_policy.description: Ethernet Adapter policy to be associated with the VMQ vNICs. The Transmit Queue and Receive Queue resource value of VMMQ adapter policy should be greater than or equal to the configured number of sub vNICs.
vmmq_adapter_policy.title: vmmq_adapter_policy

enable_encryption.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled, the endpoint encrypts all information it sends to the LDAP server.

enable_group_authorization.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled, user authorization is also done at the group level for LDAP users not in the local user database.

enable_ldap.description: Default is `true`.  LDAP server performs authentication.
enable_ldap.title: enable_ldap

ldap_from_dns.description: This Array enables the use of DNS for LDAP Server discovery.

nested_group_search_depth.description: Default is 128.  Search depth to look for a nested LDAP group in an LDAP group map.  Range is 1-128
nested_group_search_depth.title: nested_group_search_depth

user_search_precedence.description:
Default is `LocalUserDb`.  Search precedence between local user database and LDAP user database.
  * `LocalUserDb` - Precedence is given to local user database while searching.
  * `LDAPUserDb` - Precedence is given to LADP user database while searching.
user_search_precedence.title: user_search_precedence

ldap.base_settings.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.
  * Required Attributes:
  * domain

Optional Attributes:
  * base_dn
  * timeout
ldap.base_settings.title: BaseSettings

base_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) of the user, that is used to authenticate against LDAP servers.  An example would be `DC=example,DC=com`
base_dn.title: switch_id

domain.description: The LDAP domain that all users must be in.  An example would be `example.com`.
domain.title: switch_id

timeout.description: LDAP authentication timeout duration, in seconds.  Range is 0 to 180.
timeout.title: timeout

ldap.binding_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.
Required Attributes:
  * bind_method

Optional Attributes:
  * bind_dn
ldap.binding_parameters.title: binding_parameters

bind_dn.description: Base Distinguished Name (DN). Starting point from where server will search for users and groups.  An example is `CN=admin,DC=example,DC=com`
bind_dn.title: bind_dn

bind_method.description:
Default is LoginCredentials.  Authentication method to access LDAP servers.
  * `LoginCredentials` - Requires the user credentials. If the bind process fails, then user is denied access.
  * `Anonymous` - Requires no username and password. If this option is selected and the LDAP server is configured for Anonymous logins, then the user gains access.
  * `ConfiguredCredentials` - Requires a known set of credentials to be specified for the initial bind process. If the initial bind process succeeds, then the distinguished name (DN) of the user name is queried and re-used for the re-binding process. If the re-binding process fails, then the user is denied access.'
bind_method.title: bind_method

password.description: Default is `1`.  The LDAP Binding Parameter Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.binding_parameters_password`.
password.title: password

ldap.ldap_from_dns.description:
DNS settings used to access LDAP Providers.
Required Attributes:
  * search_domain

Optional Attributes:
  * search_forest
  * source
ldap.ldap_from_dns.title: ldap_from_dns

search_domain.description: Domain name that acts as a source for a DNS query.  An example would be `example.com`.
search_domain.title: search_domain

search_forest.description: Forest name that acts as a source for a DNS query.
search_forest.title: search_forest

source.description:
Default is Extracted.  Source of the domain name used for the DNS SRV request.
  * `Extracted` - The domain name extracted-domain from the login ID.
  * `Configured` - The configured-search domain.
  * `ConfiguredExtracted` - The domain name extracted from the login ID than the configured-search domain.
source.title: source

ldap.ldap_groups.title: ldap_groups - LDAP Groups - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapGroups

name.description: LDAP Group name in the LDAP server database.
name.title: username

role.description:
Default is readonly.  The name of the end point role.
  * admin
  * readonly
  * user
role.title: role

ldap.ldap_servers.title: ldap_servers - LDAP Provider Servers - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapProviders

port.description: Default is 389.  PLDAP Server Port for connection establishment.
port.title: port

server.description: LDAP Server Address, can be IP address or hostname.
server.title: username

ldap.search_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.Required Attributes:
  * attribute
  * filter
  * group_attribute
ldap.search_parameters.title: search_parameters

attribute.description: Default is CiscoAvPair.  Role and locale information of the user.
attribute.title: attribute

filter.description: Default is sAMAccountName.  Criteria to identify entries in search requests.
filter.title: filter

group_attribute.description: Default is memberOf.  Attribute that identifies the Groups to which an LDAP user belongs.
group_attribute.title: group_attribute

link_aggregation.description: A policy to configure the link settings for all the port channels (including LACP).
link_aggregation.title: link_aggregation - Link Aggregation - Intersight Uri: fabric/LinkAggregationPolicies

lacp_rate.description:
Default is `normal`.  Flag used to indicate whether LACP PDUs are to be sent 'fast', i.e., every 1 second.
  * `normal` - The expanded 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 108 ports.
  * `fast` - The standard 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 54 ports.
lacp_rate.title: lacp_rate

suspend_individual.description: Default is `false`.  Flag tells the switch whether to suspend the port if it didn’t receive LACP PDU.
suspend_individual.title: suspend_individual

link_control.description: A policy to configure the link settings for all the ports (including UDLD).
link_control.title: link_control - Link Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/LinkControlPolicies

admin_state.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Admin configured UDLD State for this port.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
admin_state.title: admin_state

mode.description:
Default is `normal`.  Admin configured UDLD Mode for this port.
  * `normal` - Admin configured 'normal' UDLD mode.
  * `aggressive` - Admin configured 'aggressive' UDLD mode.
mode.title: mode

local_user.description: Enables creation of local users on endpoints.
local_user.title: local_user - Local User - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUserPolicies

allOf.description: Enables creation of local users on endpoints.
allOf.title: local_user - Local User - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUserPolicies

users.description:
List of users to add to the local user policy.
Required Attributes:
  * username
  * password

Optional Attributes:
  * enabled
  * role
users.title: users - Users - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUsers

local_user.password_properties.description:
Set password properties for endpoint users.

Optional Attributes:
  * always_send_user_password
  * enable_password_expiry
  * enforce_strong_password
  * grace_period
  * notification_period
  * password_expiry_duration
  * password_history
local_user.password_properties.title:
password_properties - Local User Policy Password Settings.
intersight_api: iam/EndPointPasswordProperties

always_send_user_password.description: Default is `false`.  User password will always be sent to endpoint device. If the option is not selected, then user password will be sent to endpoint device for new users and if user password is changed for existing users.
always_send_user_password.title: always_send_user_password

enable_password_expiry.description: Default is `false`.  Enables password expiry on the endpoint.
enable_password_expiry.title: enable_password_expiry

enforce_strong_password.description:
Default is `true`.  Enables a strong password policy. Strong password requirements:
  * A. The password must have a minimum of 8 and a maximum of 20 characters.
  * B. The password must not contain the User's Name.
  * C. The password must contain characters from three of the following four categories.
    - 1) English uppercase characters (A through Z). 2) English lowercase characters (a through z).
    - 3) Base 10 digits (0 through 9).
    - 4) Non-alphabetic characters (! , @, #, $, %, ^, &, *, -, _, +, =).
enforce_strong_password.title: enforce_strong_password

grace_period.description: Default is 1.  Time period until when you can use the existing password, after it expires.
grace_period.title: grace_period

notification_period.description: Default is 15.  The duration after which the password will expire.
notification_period.title: notification_period

password_expiry_duration.description: Default is 90.  Set time period for password expiration. Value should be greater than notification period and grace period.
password_expiry_duration.title: password_expiry_duration

password_history.description: Default is 5.  Tracks password change history. Specifies in number of instances, that the new password was already used.
password_history.title: password_history

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the user account on the endpoint.
enabled.title: enabled

password.description: Default is `1`.  The Local User Authentication Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.local_user_password_1`.
password.title: password

role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  The name of the end point role.
  * admin
  * readonly
  * user
role.title: role

username.description: Name of the user to be created on the endpoint. It can be any string that adheres to the following constraints. It can have alphanumeric characters, dots, underscores and hyphen. It cannot be more than 16 characters.
username.title: username

mac.description: Pool represents a collection of MAC addresses that can be allocated to VNICs of a server profile.
mac.title: mac - MAC Pools - Intersight Uri: macpool/Pools

mac_blocks.description:
A block of MAC addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
mac_blocks.title: mac_blocks

from.description: Staring MAC Address.  An Example is `00:25:B5:0A:00:00`
from.title: from

size.description: Size of the Pool.  Allowed range is 1-1024.
size.title: size

to.description: Ending MAC Address.  An Example is `00:25:B5:0A:04:00`
to.title: to

mac.reservations.description:
The MAC reservation object, used to hold reserved addresses.
Required Attributes:
  * identities

Optional Attributes:
  * allocation_type
mac.reservations.title: MAC Reservations

allocation_type.description:
Type of the allocation for the identity in the reservation either static or dynamic (i.e. via pool).
  * dynamic - Identifiers to be allocated by system.
  * static - Identifiers are assigned by the user.  (default)
allocation_type.title: allocation_type

identities.description: List of MAC identities to be reserved.

items.description: MAC identity to be reserved.  Example `00:25:B5:0A:00:00`
items.title: identity

identities.title: identities

multicast.description: A policy to configure Multicast settings for all the Virtual LAN networks.
multicast.title: multicast - Multicast - Intersight Uri: fabric/MulticastPolicies

querier_ip_address.description: Used to define the IGMP Querier IP address.
querier_ip_address.title: querier_ip_address

querier_ip_address_peer.description: Used to define the IGMP Querier IP address of the peer switch.
querier_ip_address_peer.title: querier_ip_address_peer

querier_state.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Administrative state of the IGMP Querier for this VLAN.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
querier_state.title: querier_state

snooping_state.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Administrative state of the IGMP Snooping for this VLAN.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
snooping_state.title: snooping_state

source_ip_proxy_state.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Administrative state of the IGMP source IP proxy for this VLAN.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
source_ip_proxy_state.title: source_ip_proxy_state

persistent_memory.description: The Persistent Memory policy defines the reusable Persistent Memory related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows the application of Persistent Memory Goals and creation of Persistent Memory Regions and Namespaces. The encryption of the Persistent Memory Modules can be enabled through this policy by providing a passphrase.
persistent_memory.title: persistent_memory - Persistent Memory - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryPolicies

allOf.description: The Persistent Memory policy defines the reusable Persistent Memory related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows the application of Persistent Memory Goals and creation of Persistent Memory Regions and Namespaces. The encryption of the Persistent Memory Modules can be enabled through this policy by providing a passphrase.
allOf.title: persistent_memory - Persistent Memory - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryPolicies

management_mode.description:
Default is `configured-from-intersight`.  Management Mode of the policy. This can be either Configured from Intersight or Configured from Operating System.
  * `configured-from-intersight` - The Persistent Memory Modules are configured from Intersight thorugh Persistent Memory policy.
  * `configured-from-operating-system` - The Persistent Memory Modules are configured from operating system thorugh OS tools.
management_mode.title: management_mode

namespaces.description:
The list of Persistent Memory Namespace spec that need to be created through this policy.  Namespace is a partition made in one or more Persistent Memory Regions. You can create a namespace in Raw or Block mode.
Required Attributes are:
  * capacity
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * mode
  * socket_id
  * socket_memory_id
namespaces.title: namespaces - Persistent Memory Logical Namespaces - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryLogicalNamespaces

passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  The Persisentent Memory Passphrase Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.persistent_passphrase`.
passphrase.title: passphrase

retain_namespaces.description: Default is `true`.  Persistent Memory Namespaces to be retained or not.
retain_namespaces.title: retain_namespaces

persistent_memory.goal.description:
A Persistent Memory Goal that needs to be applied on the associated servers through the policy. This would result in the creation of regions and allocation of volatile memory on the server.
Required Attributes:
  * memory_mode_percentage
  * persistent_memory_type
persistent_memory.goal.title: goal - Persistent Memory Goal - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryGoals

persistent_memory_type.description:
Type of the Persistent Memory configuration where the Persistent Memory Modules are combined in an interleaved set or not.
  * `app-direct` - The App Direct interleaved Persistent Memory type.
  * `app-direct-non-interleaved` - The App Direct non-interleaved Persistent Memory type.
persistent_memory_type.title: persistent_memory_type

persistent_memory.namespaces.description: Persistent Memory Namespace specification that needs to be applied to the associated servers through this policy. This would result in the creation, modification, or deletion of a Namespace on the servers.
persistent_memory.namespaces.title: namespaces - Persistent Memory Logical Namespaces

capacity.description: Default is 1.  Capacity of this Namespace that is created or modified.
capacity.title: capacity

mode.description:
Default is `raw`.  Mode of this Namespace that is created or modified.
  * `raw` - The raw mode of Persistent Memory Namespace.
  * `block` - The block mode of Persistent Memory Namespace.
mode.title: mode

name.description: Name of this Namespace to be created on the server.
name.title: name

socket_id.description:
Default is 1.  Socket ID of the region on which this Namespace has to be created or modified.
  * `1` - The first CPU socket in a server.
  * `2` - The second CPU socket in a server.
  * `3` - The third CPU socket in a server.
  * `4` - The fourth CPU socket in a server.
socket_id.title: socket_id

socket_memory_id.description:
Default is `2`.  Socket Memory ID of the region on which this Namespace has to be created or modified.
  * `Not Applicable` - The socket memory ID is not applicable if app-direct persistent memory type is selected in the goal.
  * `2` - The second socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `4` - The fourth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `6` - The sixth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `8` - The eighth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `10` - The tenth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `12` - The twelfth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
socket_memory_id.title: socket_memory_id

port.description: A policy for all the physical ports of the Fabric Interconnect.
port.title: port - Port - Intersight Uri: fabric/PortPolicies

allOf.description: A policy for all the physical ports of the Fabric Interconnect.
allOf.title: port

device_model.description:
Default is `UCS-FI-6454`.  This field specifies the device model that this Port Policy is being configured for.
  * `UCS-FI-6454` - The standard 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 54 ports.
  * `UCS-FI-64108` - The expanded 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 108 ports.
  * `UCS-FI-6536` - The standard 5th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 36 ports.
  * `unknown` - Unknown device type, usage is TBD.
device_model.title: device_model

names.description: List of two Port Policy Names to Create.

items.description: Name of the Port Policy.
items.title: port_policy

names.title: names - Names

port_id.description:

When a port is not configured as a breakout port, the portId is the port number as labeled on the equipment,
e.g. the id of the port on the switch, FEX or chassis.
When a port is configured as a breakout port, the 'portId' represents the port id on the fanout side of the breakout cable.

power.description: Power Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Power Related Features.
power.title: power - Power - Intersight Uri: power/Policies

allOf.description: Power Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Power Related Features.
allOf.title: power - Power - Intersight Uri: power/Policies

dynamic_power_rebalancing.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Dynamic Power Rebalancing mode of the Chassis. If enabled, this mode allows the chassis to dynamically reallocate the power between servers depending on their power usage. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
dynamic_power_rebalancing.title: dynamic_power_rebalancing

extended_power_capacity.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Extended Power Capacity of the Chassis. If Enabled, this mode allows chassis available power to be increased by borrowing power from redundant power supplies.  This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
extended_power_capacity.title: extended_power_capacity

power_allocation.description: Default is 1.  Sets the Allocated Power Budget of the Chassis (in Watts). This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
power_allocation.title: power_allocation

power_priority.description:
Default is `Low`.  Sets the Power Priority of the Server. This priority is used to determine the initial power allocation for servers. This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `Low` - Set the Power Priority to Low.
  * `Medium` - Set the Power Priority to Medium.
  * `High` - Set the Power Priority to High.
power_priority.title: power_priority

power_profiling.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Power Profiling of the Server. If Enabled, this field allows the power manager to run power profiling  utility to determine the power needs of the server.  This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
power_profiling.title: power_profiling

power_redundancy.description:
Default is `Grid`.  Sets the Power Redundancy Mode of the Chassis.  Redundancy Mode determines the number of PSUs the chassis keeps as redundant.  N+2 mode is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Grid` - Grid Mode requires two power sources. If one source fails, the surviving PSUs connected to the other source provides power to the chassis.
  * `NotRedundant` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements. No Redundant PSUs are maintained.
  * `N+1` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements plus one additional PSU for redundancy.
  * `N+2` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements plus two additional PSU for redundancy. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
power_redundancy.title: power_redundancy

power_restore.description:
Default is `LastState`.  Sets the Power Restore State of the Server. In the absence of Intersight connectivity, the chassis will use this policy  to recover the host power after a power loss event.  This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `AlwaysOff` - Set the Power Restore Mode to Off.
  * `AlwaysOn` - Set the Power Restore Mode to On.
  * `LastState` - Set the Power Restore Mode to LastState.
power_restore.title: power_restore

power_save_mode.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Power Save mode of the Chassis. If the requested power budget is less than available power capacity,  the additional PSUs not required to comply with redundancy policy are placed in Power Save mode. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
power_save_mode.title: power_save_mode

resource.description: Pool represents a collection of resource. The resource can be any MO which has PoolResource meta enabled. The resource in the pool can be reserved or unreserved by using Lease API, reserved/unreserved resources can be used in the entities like server profiles.
resource.title: resource - Resource Pools - Intersight Uri: resourcepool/Pools

pool_type.description:
The resource management type in the pool, it can be either static or dynamic.
  * Static - The resources in the pool will not be changed until user manually update it. (default)
  * Dynamic - The resources in the pool will be updated dynamically based on the condition.
pool_type.title: pool_type

resource_type.description:
The type of the resource present in the pool, example 'server' its combination of RackUnit and Blade.
  * None - The resource cannot consider for Resource Pool.
  * Server - Resource Pool holds the server kind of resources, example - RackServer, Blade. (default)
resource_type.title: resource_type

serial_number_list.description: A List of Compute Serial Numbers to assign to the policy.  These must be the same type of server. Cannot be some blades and some rackmounts.

items.description: Server Serial Number.
items.title: serial_number

serial_number_list.title: serial_number_list

server_type.description:
The Server type to add to the selection filter field.  This is combined with the Serial Number List for the selector criteria.  Options are:
  * Blades: (default)
  * RackUnits
server_type.title: server_type

san_connectivity.description: SAN connectivity policy determines the network storage resources and the connections between the server and the SAN on the network. This policy enables configuration of vHBAs that the servers use to communicate with the storage network.
san_connectivity.title: san_connectivity - SAN Connectivity - Intersight Uri: vnic/SanConnectivityPolicies

allOf.description: SAN connectivity policy determines the network storage resources and the connections between the server and the SAN on the network. This policy enables configuration of vHBAs that the servers use to communicate with the storage network.
allOf.title: san_connectivity

target_platform.description:
Default is `FIAttached`.  The platform for which the server profile is applicable. It can either be:
  * Standalone - a server that is operating independently
  * FIAttached - A Server attached to a Intersight Managed Domain.
target_platform.title: target_platform

vhba_placement_mode.description:
The mode used for placement of vNICs on network adapters. It can either be Auto or Custom.
  * auto - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is automatically determined by the system.
  * custom (Default) - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is manually chosen by the user.
vhba_placement_mode.title: vhba_placement_mode

vhbas.description:
List of vHBAs to add to the SAN Connectivity Policy.
Required Attributes:
  * names
  * fibre_channel_adapter_policy
  * fibre_channel_network_policies

Optional Attributes:

wwnn_allocation_type.description:
Type of allocation selected to assign a WWNN address for the server node.
  * POOL (Default) - The user selects a pool from which the mac/wwn address will be leased for the Virtual Interface.
  * STATIC - The user assigns a static mac/wwn address for the Virtual Interface.
wwnn_allocation_type.title: wwnn_allocation_type
