persistent_lun_bindings.description: Default is `false`.  Enables retention of LUN ID associations in memory until they are manually cleared.
persistent_lun_bindings.title: persistent_lun_bindings

vhba_type.description:
Default is `fc-initiator`.  VHBA Type configuration for SAN Connectivity Policy. This configuration is supported only on Cisco VIC 14XX series and higher series of adapters.
  * `fc-initiator` - The default value set for vHBA Type Configuration. Fc-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * `fc-nvme-initiator` - Fc-nvme-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * `fc-nvme-target` - Fc-nvme-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. Currently tech-preview, only enabled with an asynchronous driver.
  * `fc-target` - Fc-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. fc-target is enabled only with an asynchronous driver.
vhba_type.title: vhba_type

wwpn_allocation_type.description:
Default is `POOL`.  Type of allocation selected to assign a WWPN address to the vhba.
  * `POOL` - The user selects a pool from which the mac/wwn address will be leased for the Virtual Interface.
  * `STATIC` - The user assigns a static mac/wwn address for the Virtual Interface.
wwpn_allocation_type.title: wwpn_allocation_type

wwpn_pools.description: A List of WWPN Pools to Assign to each of the vHBA's.

items.description: Name of the WWPN Pool.
items.title: wwpn_pool

wwpn_pools.title: wwpn_pools - Wwpn Pools - Intersight Uri: fcpool/Pools

wwpn_static_addresses.description:
A List of Static WWPN Addresses to Assign to the vHBA's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

items.description:
The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.
items.title: wwpn_address

wwpn_static_addresses.title: wwpn_static_addresses - Wwpn Static Addresses

san_connectivity.vhbas.placement.description:
Placement Settings for the virtual interface.
Required Attributes:
  * pci_order

Optional Attributes:
  * pci_links
  * slot_ids
  * switch_ids
  * uplink_ports
san_connectivity.vhbas.placement.title: placement - Placement Settings - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_links.description: Default is 0.  The PCI Link used as transport for the virtual interface. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1385 which has two.

items.description: Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is 0-3
items.title: pci_link

pci_links.title: pci_links - Pci Link - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_order.description: The order in which the virtual interface is brought up. The order assigned to an interface should be unique for all the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel interfaces on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. The order should start from zero with no overlaps. The maximum value of PCI order is limited by the number of virtual interfaces (Ethernet and Fibre-Channel) on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1340, VIC 1380 and VIC 1385 which have two.

items.description: PCI Order Assigned to the Interface. The order should start from zero with no overlaps, including LAN and SAN Policies.
items.title: pci_order

pci_order.title: pci_order - Pci Order

slot_ids.description: List of PCIe Slots where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.

items.description: PCIe Slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
items.title: slot_id

slot_ids.title: slot_ids - Slot Ids - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

switch_ids.description:
A List of the fabric port(s) to which the vNICs will be associated.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is not set to either A or B for the standalone case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects. The value 'None' should be used.
  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.

items.description:
The fabric port to which the vNICs will be associated.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is not set to either A or B for the standalone case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects. The value 'None' should be used.
  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.
items.title: switch_id

switch_ids.title: switch_ids - Switch Ids - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

uplink_ports.description: Default is 0.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  This attribute is for Standalone Servers Only.

items.description: Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is 0-3
items.title: pci_link

uplink_ports.title: uplink_ports - Uplink Port - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

baud_rate.description:
Default is 115200.  Baud Rate used for Serial Over LAN communication.
  * `9600` - Use baud rate 9600 for communication.
  * `19200` - Use baud rate 19200 for communication.
  * `38400` - Use baud rate 38400 for communication.
  * `57600` - Use baud rate 57600 for communication.
  * `115200` - Use baud rate 115200 for communication.
baud_rate.title: baud_rate

com_port.description:
Default is `com0`.  Serial port through which the system routes Serial Over LAN communication. This field is available only on some Cisco UCS C-Series servers. If it is unavailable, the server uses COM port 0 by default.
  * `com0` - Use serial port com0 for communication.
  * `com1` - Use serial port com1 for communication.

* Unassign - will detach the profile from the hardware.

ldap_policy.description: The Name of the LDAP Policy to Assign to the Profile(s).  This is only Applicable to Standalone Servers.

local_user_policy.description: The Name of the Local User Policy to Assign to the Profile(s).

persistent_memory_policy.description: The Name of the Persistent Memory Policy to Assign to the Profile(s).  This is only Applicable to Standalone Servers.

target_platform.description:
Default is `FIAttached`.  The platform for which the server profile is applicable. It can either be a server that is operating in standalone mode or which is attached to a Fabric Interconnect managed by Intersight.
* `Standalone` - Servers which are operating in standalone mode i.e. not connected to a Fabric Interconnected.
* `FIAttached` - Servers which are connected to a Fabric Interconnect that is managed by Intersight.
target_platform.title: target_platform

targets.description:
A List of Servers to Assign these policies/settings to.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * serial_number or pre_assign

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * static_uuid_address
targets.title: targets - Server Targets

ucs_server_template.description: The Name of the Server Profile Template to Create the Profile(s) from.
ucs_server_template.title: ucs_server_template

uuid_pool.description: The Name of the UUID Pool to Assign to the Profile(s).  This is only Applicable to FIAttached Servers.
uuid_pool.title: uuid_pool

virtual_kvm_policy.description: The Name of the KVM Policy to Assign to the Profile(s).
virtual_kvm_policy.title: virtual_kvm_policy

virtual_media_policy.description: The Name of the Virtual Media Policy to Assign to the Profile(s).
virtual_media_policy.title: virtual_media_policy

static_uuid_address.description: A Static UUID Address to Assign to the Server Profile.
static_uuid_address.title: static_uuid_address

server.targets.pre_assign.description: Enabled the Pre-Assignment of a Server Profile to either a Chassis/Slot or using the Serial Number.  * Note - If using Chassis/Slot make sure you have defined the domain_name as well to the Server Profile Section.
server.targets.pre_assign.title: pre_assign

chassis_id.description: Default is 0 (Unused).  The Chassis Id to Pre-Assign this Server Profile to.
chassis_id.title: chassis_id

slot_id.description: Default is 0.  The Slot Identity to Assign the Server Profile to.
slot_id.title: slot_id

smtp.description: Name that identifies the SMTP Policy.
smtp.title: smtp - SMTP - Intersight Uri: smtp/Policies

allOf.description: Name that identifies the SMTP Policy.
allOf.title: smtp

enable_smtp.description: Default is `true`.  If enabled, controls the state of the SMTP client service on the managed device.
enable_smtp.title: enable_smtp

mail_alert_recipients.description: List of Emails to send alerts to.

items.description:
Minimum fault severity level to receive email notifications. Email notifications are sent for all faults whose severity is equal to or greater than the chosen level.
  * critical - Minimum severity to report is critical.
  * condition - Minimum severity to report is informational.
  * warning - Minimum severity to report is warning.
  * minor - Minimum severity to report is minor.
  * major - Minimum severity to report is major.
items.title: mail_alert_recipient

mail_alert_recipients.title: mail_alert_recipients - Mail Alert Recipients

minimum_severity.description:
Default is `critical`.  Minimum fault severity level to receive email notifications. Email notifications are sent for all faults whose severity is equal to or greater than the chosen level.
  * `critical` - Minimum severity to report is critical.
  * `condition` - Minimum severity to report is informational.
  * `warning` - Minimum severity to report is warning.
  * `minor` - Minimum severity to report is minor.
  * `major` - Minimum severity to report is major.
minimum_severity.title: minimum_severity

smtp_alert_sender_address.description: The email address entered here will be displayed as the from address (mail received from address) of all the SMTP mail alerts that are received. If not configured, the hostname of the server is used in the from address field.
smtp_alert_sender_address.title: smtp_alert_sender_address

smtp_port.description: Default is 25.  Port number used by the SMTP server for outgoing SMTP communication.
smtp_port.title: smtp_port

smtp_server_address.description: IP address or hostname of the SMTP server. The SMTP server is used by the managed device to send email notifications.
smtp_server_address.title: smtp_server_address

snmp.description: Policy to configure SNMP settings on endpoint.
snmp.title: snmp - SNMP - Intersight Uri: snmp/Policies

allOf.description: Policy to configure SNMP settings on endpoint.
allOf.title: snmp

access_community_string.description: Default is `1`.  The Sensitive Variable Identifier for the Access Community String.  i.e. `var.access_community_string_1`.  The SNMP Access Community String for devices performing SNMP Queries against the appliance for SNMPv1/v2c. The value can be 18 characters long.
access_community_string.title: access_community_string

enable_snmp.description: Default is `true`.  State of the SNMP Policy on the endpoint. If enabled, the endpoint sends SNMP traps to the designated host.
enable_snmp.title: enable_snmp

snmp_community_access.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Controls access to the information in the inventory tables. Applicable only for SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c users.
  * `Disabled` - Blocks access to the information in the inventory tables.
  * `Limited` - Partial access to read the information in the inventory tables.
  * `Full` - Full access to read the information in the inventory tables.
snmp_community_access.title: snmp_community_access

snmp_engine_input_id.description: User-defined unique identification of the static engine.
snmp_engine_input_id.title: snmp_engine_input_id

snmp_port.description: Default is 161.  Port on which Cisco IMC SNMP agent runs. Enter a value between 1-65535. Reserved ports not allowed (22, 23, 80, 123, 389, 443, 623, 636, 2068, 3268, 3269).
snmp_port.title: snmp_port

snmp_trap_destinations.description:
List of SNMP Trap Destinations to Assign to the Policy.
Required Attributes:
  * destination_address

SNMPv2 Requires:
  * community_string

SNMPv3 Requires:
  * user

Optional Attributes:
  * enable
  * port
  * trap_type
snmp_trap_destinations.title: snmp_trap_destinations - Snmp Trap Destinations - object_type: snmp.Trap

snmp_users.description:
List of SNMP Users to Assign to the SNMP Policy.
Required Attributes:
  * auth_password
  * name
  * security_level

Optional Attributes:
  * auth_type
  * privacy_password
  * privacy_type
snmp_users.title: snmp_users - Snmp Users - object_type: snmp.User

system_contact.description: Contact person responsible for the SNMP implementation. Enter a string up to 64 characters, such as an email address or a name and telephone number.
system_contact.title: system_contact

system_location.description: Location of host on which the SNMP agent (server) runs.
system_location.title: system_location

trap_community_string.description: Default is `1`.  The Sensitive Variable Identifier for the Trap Community String.  i.e. `var.snmp_trap_community_1`.  The SNMP Trap Community String will be used for sending Trap notification to devices utilizing SNMPv1/v2c. The value can be 18 characters long.
trap_community_string.title: trap_community_string

snmp.snmp_trap_destinations.description: Destination Servers for trap message sent from an agent to the manager.
snmp.snmp_trap_destinations.title: snmp_remote_destinations - SNMP Trap Servers.

community_string.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_auth_password_[1-5].  Any other number means no community string.
community_string.title: community_string

destination_address.description: Address to which the SNMP trap information is sent.
destination_address.title: destination_address

enable.description: Default is `true`.  Enables/disables the trap on the server If enabled, trap is active on the server.
enable.title: enable

port.description: Default is 162.  Port used by the server to communicate with the trap destination. Enter a value between 1-65535. Reserved ports not allowed (22, 23, 80, 123, 389, 443, 623, 636, 2068, 3268, 3269).
port.title: port

trap_type.description:
Default is `Trap`.  Type of trap which decides whether to receive a notification when a trap is received at the destination.
  * `Trap` - Do not receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination.
  * `Inform` - Receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination. This option is valid only for V2 users.
trap_type.title: trap_type

user.description: SNMP user for the trap. Applicable only to SNMPv3.
user.title: user

snmp.snmp_users.description: User based security model, for communication between an agent and manager. Applicable only for SNMPv3.
snmp.snmp_users.title: users - SNMP V3 Users

auth_password.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between to denote to use one of the variables, i.e. `var.snmp_auth_password_[1-5]`.
auth_password.title: auth_password

auth_type.description:
Default is `SHA`.  Authorization protocol for authenticating the user.
  * `MD5` - MD5 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * `SHA` - SHA protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
auth_type.title: auth_type

name.description: SNMP username. Must have a minimum of 1 and and a maximum of 31 characters.  Cannot be `admin`.
name.title: name

privacy_password.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between to denote to use one of the variables, i.e. `var.snmp_privacy_password_[1-5]`.
privacy_password.title: privacy_password

privacy_type.description:
Default is `AES`.  Privacy protocol for the user.
  * `NA` - Privacy protocol is not applicable.
  * `DES` - DES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
  * `AES` - AES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
privacy_type.title: privacy_type

security_level.description:
Default is `AuthPriv`.  Security mechanism used for communication between agent and manager.
  * `AuthPriv` - The user requires both an authorization password and a privacy password.
  * `NoAuthNoPriv` - The user does not require an authorization or privacy password.
  * `AuthNoPriv` - The user requires an authorization password but not a privacy password.
security_level.title: security_level

ssh.description: Secure shell policy on the endpoint.
ssh.title: ssh - SSH - Intersight Uri: ssh/Policies

allOf.description: Secure shell policy on the endpoint.
allOf.title: ssh - SSH - Intersight Uri: ssh/Policies

enable_ssh.description: Default is `true`.  State of SSH service on the endpoint.
enable_ssh.title: enable_ssh

ssh_port.description: Default is 22.  Port used for secure shell access.
ssh_port.title: ssh_port

ssh_timeout.description: Default is 1800.  Number of seconds to wait before the system considers a SSH request to have timed out.
ssh_timeout.title: ssh_timeout

storage.description: The storage policy models the reusable storage related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows creation of RAID groups using existing disk group policies and virtual drives on the drive groups. The user has options to move all unused disks to JBOD or Unconfigured good state. The encryption of drives can be enabled through this policy using remote keys from a KMIP server.
storage.title: storage - Storage - Intersight Uri: storage/StoragePolicies

allOf.description: The storage policy models the reusable storage related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows creation of RAID groups using existing disk group policies and virtual drives on the drive groups. The user has options to move all unused disks to JBOD or Unconfigured good state. The encryption of drives can be enabled through this policy using remote keys from a KMIP server.
allOf.title: storage

default_drive_state.description:
Default is `UnconfiguredGood`.  All unconfigured drives (non-user configured drives) will move to the selected state on deployment. Newly inserted drives will move to the selected state. Select Unconfigured Good option to retain the existing configuration. Select JBOD to move the unconfigured drives to JBOD state. Select RAID0 to create a RAID0 virtual drive on each of the unconfigured drives. If JBOD is selected, unconfigured drives will move to JBOD state on host reboot. This setting is applicable only to selected set of controllers on FI attached servers.
  * `UnconfiguredGood` - Newly inserted drives or on reboot, drives will remain the same state.
  * `Jbod` - Newly inserted drives or on reboot, drives will automatically move to JBOD state if drive state was UnconfiguredGood.
  * `RAID0` - Newly inserted drives or on reboot, virtual drives will be created, respective drives will move to Online state.
default_drive_state.title: default_drive_state

drive_groups.description:
A reusable RAID drive group configuration that specifies a pool of drives and a set of virtual drives that are to be created using this pool of drives.

  * name
Optional Attributes are:
  * automatic_drive_group
  * manual_drive_group
  * raid_level
  * virtual_drives

global_hot_spares.description: A collection of disks that is to be used as hot spares, globally, for all the RAID groups. Allowed value is a number range separated by a comma or a hyphen.
global_hot_spares.title: global_hot_spares

unused_disks_state.description:
Default is `NoChange`.  State to which drives, not used in this policy, are to be moved. NoChange will not change the drive state. No Change must be selected if Default Drive State is set to JBOD or RAID0.
  * `NoChange` - Drive state will not be modified by Storage Policy.
  * `UnconfiguredGood` - Unconfigured good state -ready to be added in a RAID group.
  * `Jbod` - JBOD state where the disks start showing up to Host OS.
unused_disks_state.title: unused_disks_state

use_jbod_for_vd_creation.description: Default is `false`.  Disks in JBOD State are used to create virtual drives. This setting must be disabled if Default Drive State is set to JBOD.
use_jbod_for_vd_creation.title: use_jbod_for_vd_creation

storage.drive_groups.description: A reusable RAID drive group configuration that specifies a pool of drives and a set of virtual drives that are to be created using this pool of drives.
storage.drive_groups.title: drive_groups - Drive Groups - Intersight Uri: storage/DriveGroups

name.description: The name of the drive group. The name can be between 1 and 64 alphanumeric characters. Spaces or any special characters other than - (hyphen), _ (underscore), : (colon), and . (period) are not allowed.
name.title: name

raid_level.description:
Default is `Raid1`.  The supported RAID level for the disk group.
  * `Raid0` - RAID 0 Stripe Raid Level.
  * `Raid1` - RAID 1 Mirror Raid Level.
  * `Raid5` - RAID 5 Mirror Raid Level.
  * `Raid6` - RAID 6 Mirror Raid Level.
  * `Raid10` - RAID 10 Mirror Raid Level.
  * `Raid50` - RAID 50 Mirror Raid Level.
  * `Raid60` - RAID 60 Mirror Raid Level.
raid_level.title: raid_level

virtual_drives.description:
The list of virtual drives and the disk groups that need to be created through this policy.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * boot_drive
  * expand_to_available
  * size
  * virtual_drive_policy
virtual_drives.title: virtual_drives - Virtual Drives

storage.drive_groups.automatic_drive_gro.description: Pool represents a collection of IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses that can be allocated to other configuration entities like server profiles.
storage.drive_groups.automatic_drive_gro.title: AutomaticDriveGroups

drives_per_span.description: Default is 1.  Number of drives within this span group. The minimum number of disks needed in a span group varies based on RAID level. RAID0 requires at least one disk. RAID1 and RAID10 requires at least 2 and in multiples of . RAID5 and RAID50 require at least 3 disks in a span group. RAID6 and RAID60 require atleast 4 disks in a span.
drives_per_span.title: drives_per_span

drive_type.description:
Default is `Any`.  Type of drive that should be used for this RAID group.
  * `Any` - Any type of drive can be used for virtual drive creation.
  * `HDD` - Hard disk drives should be used for virtual drive creation.
  * `SSD` - Solid state drives should be used for virtual drive creation.
drive_type.title: drive_type

minimum_drive_size.description: Default is 1.  Minimum size of the drive to be used for creating this RAID group.
minimum_drive_size.title: minimum_drive_size

num_dedicated_hot_spares.description: Number of dedicated hot spare disks for this RAID group. Allowed value is a comma or hyphen separated number range.
num_dedicated_hot_spares.title: num_dedicated_hot_spares

number_of_spans.description: Default is 1.  Number of span groups to be created for this RAID group. Non-nested RAID levels have a single span.
number_of_spans.title: number_of_spans

use_remaining_drives.description: Default is `false`.  This flag enables the drive group to use all the remaining drives on the server.
use_remaining_drives.title: use_remaining_drives

storage.drive_groups.manual_drive_group.description:
This drive group is created by specifying the drive slots to be used.
Required Attributes:
  * drive_array_spans

Optional Attributes:
  * dedicated_hot_spares
storage.drive_groups.manual_drive_group.title: manual_drive_group - Manual Drive Group - object_type: storage.ManualDriveGroup

dedicated_hot_spares.description: A collection of drives to be used as hot spares for this Drive Group.
dedicated_hot_spares.title: dedicated_hot_spares

drive_array_spans.description:
Enter list of Disk IDs separated by comma or hypen. Sample format is 1, 3 or 4-6, 8. Non spanned RAID levels like RAID0, RAID1, RAID5 and RAID6 expect a single group of disks whereas spanned RAID levels need multiple groups of disks with each group representing a span group. Non spanned RAID levels expect one span group and spanned RAID levels accept minimum 2 span groups and up to 8.
Required Attributes:
  * slots
drive_array_spans.title: drive_array_spans - Drive Array Spans - object_type: storage.SpanDrives

storage.drive_groups.manual_drive_group..description: This models a single span group of disks in a RAID group.
storage.drive_groups.manual_drive_group..title: drive_array_spans - Single Span Group of disks in a Raid Group - object_type: storage.SpanDrives

slots.description: Default is 1-2.  Collection of local disks that are part of this span group. Allowed value is a comma or hyphen separated number range. The minimum number of disks needed in a span group varies based on RAID level. RAID0 requires at least one disk, RAID1 and RAID10 requires at least 2 and in multiples of 2, RAID5 RAID50 RAID6 and RAID60 require at least 3 disks in a span group.
slots.title: slots

storage.drive_groups.virtual_drives.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'storage.VirtualDriveConfiguration', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
storage.drive_groups.virtual_drives.title: VirtualDrive

boot_drive.description: (bool) This flag enables this virtual drive to be used as a boot drive.
boot_drive.title: boot_drive

expand_to_available.description: (bool) This flag enables the virtual drive to use all the space available in the disk group. When this flag is enabled, the size property is ignored.
expand_to_available.title: expand_to_available

name.description: The name of the virtual drive. The name can be between 1 and 15 alphanumeric characters. Spaces or any special characters other than - (hyphen), _ (underscore), : (colon), and . (period) are not allowed.
name.title: name

size.description: (int) Virtual drive size in MebiBytes. Size is mandatory field except when the Expand to Available option is enabled.
size.title: size

storage.m2_raid_configuration.description:
This models the options for creating a virtual drive on M.2 RAID controller.
Required Attributes
  * slot
storage.m2_raid_configuration.title: m2_raid_configuration - object_type: storage.M2VirtualDriveConfig

slot.description:
Default is `MSTOR-RAID-1`.  Select the M.2 RAID controller slot on which the virtual drive is to be created. Select 'MSTOR-RAID-1' to create virtual drive on the M.2 RAID controller in the first slot or in the MSTOR-RAID slot, 'MSTOR-RAID-2' for second slot, 'MSTOR-RAID-1, MSTOR-RAID-2' for both slots or either slot.
  * `MSTOR-RAID-1` - Virtual drive  will be created on the M.2 RAID controller in the first slot.
  * `MSTOR-RAID-2` - Virtual drive  will be created on the M.2 RAID controller in the second slot, if available.
  * `MSTOR-RAID-1,MSTOR-RAID-2` - Virtual drive  will be created on the M.2 RAID controller in both the slots, if available.
slot.title: drive_slots

storage.single_drive_raid0_configuration.description: This models a Single Drive RAID Configuration for creation of on RAID0 virtual drive per physical drive and occupying the full disk space on the same.
storage.single_drive_raid0_configuration.title: single_drive_raid0_configuration - Single Drive Raid0 Configuration - object_type: storage.R0Drive

drive_slots.description: The set of drive slots where RAID0 virtual drives must be created.
drive_slots.title: drive_slots

storage.virtual_drive_policy.description:
This models the manual drive selection configuration.

Optional Attributes:
  * access_policy
  * drive_cache
  * read_policy
  * strip_size
  * write_policy
storage.virtual_drive_policy.title: virtual_drive_poliy - Storage Virtual Drive Policy.

access_policy.description:
(string) Access policy that host has on this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default access mode.
  * ReadWrite - Enables host to perform read-write on the VD.
  * ReadOnly - Host can only read from the VD.
  * Blocked - Host can neither read nor write to the VD.
access_policy.title: access_policy

drive_cache.description:
(string) Disk cache policy for the virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default drive cache mode.
  * NoChange - Drive cache policy is unchanged.
  * Enable - Enables IO caching on the drive.
  * Disable - Disables IO caching on the drive.
drive_cache.title: drive_cache

read_policy.description:
(string) Read ahead mode to be used to read data from this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default read ahead mode.
  * ReadAhead - Use read ahead mode for the policy.
  * NoReadAhead - Do not use read ahead mode for the policy.
read_policy.title: read_policy

strip_size.description:
(int) Desired strip size - Allowed values are 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024.
  * 64 - Number of bytes in a strip is 64 Kibibytes.
  * 128 - Number of bytes in a strip is 128 Kibibytes.
  * 256 - Number of bytes in a strip is 256 Kibibytes.
  * 512 - Number of bytes in a strip is 512 Kibibytes.
  * 1024 - Number of bytes in a strip is 1024 Kibibytes or 1 Mebibyte.
strip_size.title: strip_size

write_policy.description:
(string) Write mode to be used to write data to this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default write mode.
  * WriteThrough - Data is written through the cache and to the physical drives. Performance is improved, because subsequent reads of that data can be satisfied from the cache.
  * WriteBackGoodBbu - Data is stored in the cache, and is only written to the physical drives when space in the cache is needed. Virtual drives requesting this policy fall back to Write Through caching when the battery backup unit (BBU) cannot guarantee the safety of the cache in the event of a power failure.
  * AlwaysWriteBack - With this policy, write caching remains Write Back even if the battery backup unit is defective or discharged.
write_policy.title: write_policy

switch_control.description: A policy to configure the Switching Mode, Port VLAN Optimization, MAC Aging Time, Reserved VLAN Range of the FI.
switch_control.title: switch_control - Switch Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/SwitchControlPolicies

allOf.description: A policy to configure the Switching Mode, Port VLAN Optimization, MAC Aging Time, Reserved VLAN Range of the FI.
allOf.title: switch_control

ethernet_switching_mode.description:
Default is `end-host`.  Enable or Disable Ethernet End Host Switching Mode.
  * `end-host` - In end-host mode, the fabric interconnects appear to the upstream devices as end hosts with multiple links.In this mode, the switch does not run Spanning Tree Protocol and avoids loops by following a set of rules for traffic forwarding.In case of ethernet switching mode - Ethernet end-host mode is also known as Ethernet host virtualizer.
  * `switch` - In switch mode, the switch runs Spanning Tree Protocol to avoid loops, and broadcast and multicast packets are handled in the traditional way.This is the traditional switch mode.
ethernet_switching_mode.title: ethernet_switching_mode

fc_switching_mode.description:
Default is `end-host`.  Enable or Disable FC End Host Switching Mode.
  * `end-host` - In end-host mode, the fabric interconnects appear to the upstream devices as end hosts with multiple links.In this mode, the switch does not run Spanning Tree Protocol and avoids loops by following a set of rules for traffic forwarding.In case of ethernet switching mode - Ethernet end-host mode is also known as Ethernet host virtualizer.
  * `switch` - In switch mode, the switch runs Spanning Tree Protocol to avoid loops, and broadcast and multicast packets are handled in the traditional way.This is the traditional switch mode.
fc_switching_mode.title: fc_switching_mode

mac_address_table_aging.description:
Default is `Default`.  This specifies one of the option to configure the MAC address aging time.
  * `Default` - This option sets the default MAC address aging time to 14500 seconds for End Host mode.
  * `Custom` - This option allows the the user to configure the MAC address aging time on the switch. For Switch Model UCS-FI-6454 or higher, the valid range is 120 to 918000 seconds and the switch will set the lower multiple of 5 of the given time.
  * `Never` - This option disables the MAC address aging process and never allows the MAC address entries to get removed from the table.
mac_address_table_aging.title: mac_address_table_aging

mac_aging_time.description: Default is 14500.  Define the MAC address aging time in seconds. This field is valid when the "Custom" MAC address aging option is selected.
mac_aging_time.title: mac_aging_time

reserved_vlan_start_id.description:
Default is 3915.  The starting ID for VLANs reserved for internal use within the Fabric Interconnect. This VLAN ID is the starting ID of 
a contiguous block of 128 VLANs that cannot be configured for user data.  This range of VLANs cannot be configured in 
VLAN policy.
If this property is not configured, VLAN range 3915 - 4042 is reserved for internal use by default.
reserved_vlan_start_id.title: reserved_vlan_start_id

vlan_port_count_optimization.description: Default is `false`.  To enable or disable the VLAN port count optimization.
vlan_port_count_optimization.title: vlan_port_count_optimization

switch_control.udld_global_settings.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'fabric.UdldGlobalSettings', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
switch_control.udld_global_settings.title: udld_global_settings - UDLD Global Settings - object_type: fabric.UdldGlobalSettings

message_interval.description:
Default is 15.  Configures the time between UDLD probe messages on ports that are in advertisement mode and are
currently determined to be bidirectional.
Valid values are from 7 to 90 seconds.
message_interval.title: udld_message_interval

recovery_action.description:
UDLD recovery when enabled, attempts to bring an UDLD error-disabled port out of reset.
  * `none` - The standard 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 54 ports.
  * `reset` - The expanded 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 108 ports.
recovery_action.title: udld_recovery_action

minimum_severity.description:
Default is warning.  Lowest level of messages to be included in the local log.
  * `warning` - Use logging level warning for logs classified as warning.
  * `emergency` - Use logging level emergency for logs classified as emergency.
  * `alert` - Use logging level alert for logs classified as alert.
  * `critical` - Use logging level critical for logs classified as critical.
  * `error` - Use logging level error for logs classified as error.
  * `notice` - Use logging level notice for logs classified as notice.
  * `informational` - Use logging level informational for logs classified as informational.
  * `debug` - Use logging level debug for logs classified as debug.
minimum_severity.title: minimum_severity

syslog.remote_logging.description: Lists properties that are common to all remote logging clients. It serves as a base class for all remote logging clients.
syslog.remote_logging.title: remote_logging - Syslog Remote Logging

enable.description: Default is `true`.  Enables/disables remote logging for the endpoint If enabled, log messages will be sent to the syslog server mentioned in the Hostname/IP Address field.
enable.title: enable

hostname.description: Hostname or IP Address of the syslog server where log should be stored.
hostname.title: hostname

minimum_severity.description:
Default is `warning`.  Lowest level of messages to be included in the remote log.
  * `warning` - Use logging level warning for logs classified as warning.
  * `emergency` - Use logging level emergency for logs classified as emergency.
  * `alert` - Use logging level alert for logs classified as alert.
  * `critical` - Use logging level critical for logs classified as critical.
  * `error` - Use logging level error for logs classified as error.
  * `notice` - Use logging level notice for logs classified as notice.
  * `informational` - Use logging level informational for logs classified as informational.
  * `debug` - Use logging level debug for logs classified as debug.
minimum_severity.title: minimum_severity

port.description: Default is 514.  Port number used for logging on syslog server.
port.title: port

protocol.description:
Transport layer protocol for transmission of log messages to syslog server.
  * `udp` - Use User Datagram Protocol (UDP) for syslog remote server connection.
  * `tcp` - Use Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) for syslog remote server connection.
protocol.title: protocol

classes.description:
System QoS Classes to Configure for the Domain.
Required Attributes:
  * priority - {Best Effort|Bronze|FC|Gold|Platinum|Silver}
  * state

Optional Attributes:
  * bandwidth_percent
  * cos
  * packet_drop
  * weight
classes.title: classes - Classes

configure_default_classes.description:
Flag to Configure the following class values:
Note: MTU Will be configured based on the Jumbo MTU Flag

classes:
  - bandwidth_percent: 50
    cos: 255
    packet_drop: true
    priority: Best Effort
    state: Enabled
    weight: 10
  - bandwidth_percent: 50
    cos: 3
    mtu: 2240
    packet_drop: false
    priority: FC
    state: Enabled
    weight: 10
configure_default_classes.title: configure_default_classes

configure_recommended_classes.description:
Flag to Configure the following class values:
Note: MTU Will be configured based on the Jumbo MTU Flag

classes:
  - bandwidth_percent: 10
    cos: 255
    packet_drop: true
    priority: Best Effort
    state: Enabled
    weight: 5
  - bandwidth_percent: 14
    cos: 1
    packet_drop: true
    priority: Bronze
    state: Enabled
    weight: 7
  - bandwidth_percent: 18
    cos: 4
    packet_drop: true
    priority: Gold
    state: Enabled
    weight: 9
  - bandwidth_percent: 20
    cos: 3
    mtu: 2240
    packet_drop: false
    priority: FC
    state: Enabled
    weight: 10
  - bandwidth_percent: 20
    cos: 5
    packet_drop: false
    priority: Platinum
    state: Enabled
    weight: 10
  - bandwidth_percent: 18
    cos: 2
    packet_drop: true
    priority: Silver
    state: Enabled
    weight: 8
configure_recommended_classes.title: configure_recommended_classes

jumbo_mtu.description: Flag to Enable Jumbo MTU Support.
jumbo_mtu.title: jumbo_mtu

bandwidth_percent.description: Percentage of bandwidth received by the traffic tagged with this QoS.  Range is 0-100
bandwidth_percent.title: bandwidth_percent

cos.description:
Class of service Assigned to the System QoS Class.
  * Best Effort - By default is 255 and cannot be changed.
  * Bronze - By default is 1.
  * FC - By default is 3 and cannot be changed.
  * Gold - By default is 4.
  * Platinum - By default is 5.
  * Silver - By default is 2.
cos.title: cos

packet_drop.description: The weight of the QoS Class controls the distribution of bandwidth between QoS Classes, with the same priority after the Guarantees for the QoS Classes are reached.
packet_drop.title: packet_drop

priority.description:
Name of the priority class.  You must configure all the following classes:
  1. Best Effort
  2. Bronze
  3. FC
  4. Gold
  5. Platinum
  6. Silver
priority.title: priority

state.description:
Administrative state for the QoS class.
  * Disabled - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * Enabled - Admin configured Enabled State.
Note: 'Best Effort' and 'FC' Classes are 'Enabled' and cannot be 'Disabled'.
state.title: state

weight.description:
The weight of the QoS Class controls the distribution of bandwidth between QoS Classes,with the same priority after the Guarantees for the QoS Classes are reached.  Default is 1.
  * Best Effort - By Default is 5.
  * Bronze - By Default is 7.
  * FC - By Default is 5.
  * Gold - By Default is 9.
  * Platinum - By Default is 10.
  * Silver - By Default is 8.
weight.title: weight

* `Standalone` - Servers which are operating in standalone mode i.e. not connected to a Fabric Interconnected.
* `FIAttached` - Servers which are connected to a Fabric Interconnect that is managed by Intersight.

fan_control_mode.description:
Default is `Balanced`.  Sets the Fan Control Mode of the System. High Power, Maximum Power and Acoustic modes are only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Balanced` - The fans run faster when needed based on the heat generated by the server. When possible, the fans returns to the minimum required speed.
  * `LowPower` - The Fans run at the minimum speed required to keep the server cool.
  * `HighPower` - The fans are kept at higher speed to emphasizes performance over power consumption. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
  * `MaximumPower` - The fans are always kept at maximum speed. This option provides the most cooling and consumes the most power. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Acoustic` - The fan speed is reduced to reduce noise levels in acoustic-sensitive environments. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
fan_control_mode.title: fan_control_mode

virtual_media.add_virtual_media.title: add_virtual_media - Add Virtual Media Mappings

authentication_protocol.description:
Default is `none`.  Type of Authentication protocol when CIFS is used for communication with the remote server.
  * none - (Default) No authentication is used.
  * ntlm - NT LAN Manager (NTLM) security protocol. Use this option only with Windows 2008 R2 and Windows 2012 R2.
  * ntlmi - NTLMi security protocol. Use this option only when you enable Digital Signing in the CIFS Windows server.
  * ntlmv2 - NTLMv2 security protocol. Use this option only with Samba Linux.
  * ntlmv2i - NTLMv2i security protocol. Use this option only with Samba Linux.
  * ntlmssp - NT LAN Manager Security Support Provider (NTLMSSP) protocol. Use this option only with Windows 2008 R2 and Windows 2012 R2.
  * ntlmsspi - NTLMSSPi protocol. Use this option only when you enable Digital Signing in the CIFS Windows server.
authentication_protocol.title: authentication_protocol

device_type.description:
Defualt is `cdd`.  Type of remote Virtual Media device.
  * cdd - (Default) Uses compact disc drive as the virtual media mount device.
  * hdd - Uses hard disk drive as the virtual media mount device.
device_type.title: device_type

file_location.description:
The remote file location path for the virtual media mapping. Accepted formats are:
  * HDD for CIFS/NFS: hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.img
  * CDD for CIFS/NFS: hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.iso
  * HDD for HTTP/S: http[s]://hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.img
  * CDD for HTTP/S: http[s]://hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.iso
file_location.title: file_location

mount_options.description:
Mount options for the Virtual Media mapping. The field can be left blank or filled in a comma separated list with the following options.
For NFS, supported options are:
  * ro
  * rw
  * nolock
  * noexec
  * soft
  * port=VALUE
  * timeo=VALUE
  * retry=VALUE
For CIFS, supported options are:
  * soft
  * nounix
  * noserverino
  * guest
Note: For CIFS version less than 3.0, vers=VALUE is mandatory. e.g. vers=2.0
For HTTP/HTTPS, the only supported option is:
  * noauto
mount_options.title: mount_options

name.description:
Protocol to use to communicate with the remote server.
  * nfs - NFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * cifs - CIFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * http - HTTP protocol for vmedia mount.
  * https - HTTPS protocol for vmedia mount.
name.title: protocol

password.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between to denote to use one of the variables, i.e. `var.vmedia_password_[1-5]`.
password.title: password

protocol.description:
Default is `https`.  Protocol to use to communicate with the remote server.
  * nfs - NFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * cifs - CIFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * http - HTTP protocol for vmedia mount.
  * https - HTTPS protocol for vmedia mount.
protocol.title: protocol
